body_html:
Yes, you can use it on Windows. There was a slight issue with RC0 on Windows, but you can use the following:

 <dependency>
   <groupId>org.tensorflow</groupId>
   <artifactId>tensorflow</artifactId>
   <version>1.1.0-rc0-windows-fix</version>
 </dependency>
body_text:
Yes, you can use it on Windows. There was a slight issue with RC0 on Windows, but you can use the following:
 <dependency>
   <groupId>org.tensorflow</groupId>
   <artifactId>tensorflow</artifactId>
   <version>1.1.0-rc0-windows-fix</version>
 </dependency>
body:
Yes, you can use it on Windows. There was a slight issue with RC0 on Windows, but you can use the following:

```xml
 <dependency>
   <groupId>org.tensorflow</groupId>
   <artifactId>tensorflow</artifactId>
   <version>1.1.0-rc0-windows-fix</version>
 </dependency>
 ```
